benchmark_details.name: HeteroCorpus
benchmark_details.overview: A corpus created specifically for studying heteronormative language in English, consisting of 7,265 manually annotated tweets.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To identify and mitigate heteronormative language in NLP systems.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on the classification performance of the models.
methodology.interpretation: BERT models outperformed traditional classifiers indicating the complexity of identifying heteronormativity.
methodology.validation: Cohen's Kappa and Fleiss' Kappa used to assess annotation reliability.

targeted_risks.harm: Potential perpetuation of stereotypes and exclusion of non-binary identities.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All tweets posted publicly with identifying characteristics removed.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Dataset follows Twitter's privacy policy and is not fully released.
